query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
1 Così di ponte in ponte, altro parlando 2 che la mia comedìa cantar non cura, 3 venimmo; e tenavamo ’l colmo, quando
4 restammo per veder l’altra fessura 5 di Malebolge e li altri pianti vani; 6 e vidila mirabilmente oscura.
query.result:
1 Thus from bridge to bridge, speaking otherwise 2 that my comedy singing does not care, 3 we came; and we were holding the summit, when
4 we remained to see the other fissure 5 of Malebolge and the other vain cries; 6 and I saw it marvelously dark.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
7 Quale ne l’arzanà de’ Viniziani 8 bolle l’inverno la tenace pece 9 a rimpalmare i legni lor non sani,
10 ché navicar non ponno—in quella vece 11 chi fa suo legno novo e chi ristoppa 12 le coste a quel che più vïaggi fece;
13 chi ribatte da proda e chi da poppa; 14 altri fa remi e altri volge sarte; 15 chi terzeruolo e artimon rintoppa—:
16 tal, non per foco ma per divin’ arte, 17 bollia là giuso una pegola spessa, 18 che ’nviscava la ripa d’ogne parte.
query.result:
7 Which in the arzanà of the Viniziani 8 the tenacious pitch boils the winter 9 to re‑palm their unhealthy woods,
10 because they cannot sail—in that way 11 who makes his wood new and who refills 12 the coasts to that which more voyages made;
13 who rebounds from bow and who from stern; 14 others make oars and others turn ropes; 15 who terzeruolo and artimon refits—:
16 such, not by fire but by divine art, 17 boils there down a thick pegola, 18 that encrusted the bank on every side.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
19 I’ vedea lei, ma non vedëa in essa 20 mai che le bolle che ’l bollor levava, 21 e gonfiar tutta, e riseder compressa.
query.result: 19 I saw her, but I did not see in her 20 never that the bubbles that the boil lifted, 21 and to swell all, and to sit again compressed.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
22 Mentr’ io là giù fisamente mirava, 23 lo duca mio, dicendo «Guarda, guarda!», 24 mi trasse a sé del loco dov’ io stava.
query.result: 22 While I there down firmly gazed, 23 my duke, saying “Look, look!”, 24 he drew me to himself from the place where I was.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
25 Allor mi volsi come l’uom cui tarda 26 di veder quel che li convien fuggire 27 e cui paura sùbita sgagliarda,
28 che, per veder, non indugia ’l partire: 29 e vidi dietro a noi un diavol nero 30 correndo su per lo scoglio venire.
query.result:
25 Then I turned like the man to whom it is late 26 to see what he must flee 27 and whose sudden fear is reckless,
28 who, in order to see, does not delay the departure: 29 and I saw behind us a black devil 30 running up the rock to come.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
31 Ahi quant’ elli era ne l’aspetto fero! 32 e quanto mi parea ne l’atto acerbo, 33 con l’ali aperte e sovra i piè leggero!
34 L’omero suo, ch’era aguto e superbo, 35 carcava un peccator con ambo l’anche, 36 e quei tenea de’ piè ghermito ’l nerbo.
query.result:
31 Ah, how he was in the fierce aspect! 32 and how it seemed to me in the bitter act, 33 with wings open and over the feet light!
34 His shoulder, which was sharp and proud, 35 carried a sinner with both hips, 36 and he held from the feet the hermit the nerbo.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
37 Del nostro ponte disse: «O Malebranche, 38 ecco un de li anzïan di Santa Zita! 39 Mettetel sotto, ch’i’ torno per anche
40 a quella terra, che n’è ben fornita: 41 ogn’ uom v’è barattier, fuor che Bonturo; 42 del no, per li denar, vi si fa ita».
query.result:
37 Of our bridge said: “O Malebranche, 38 here is one of the ancients of Saint Zita! 39 Put them under, that I return also
40 to that land, which there is well supplied: 41 every man there is a barterer, except Bonturo; 42 of the no, for the money, it is made thus”.

Please translate each line literally into English.
43 Là giù ’l buttò, e per lo scoglio duro 44 si volse; e mai non fu mastino sciolto 45 con tanta fretta a seguitar lo furo.
query.result: 43 There down he threw, and across the hard rock 44 he turned; and never was the mastiff set free 45 with such haste to pursue them.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.

query.result:
46 He got stuck, and went back up tangled; 47 but the demons that of the bridge had a lid, 48 shout: “Here the Holy Face has no place!
49 here one swims differently than in the Serchio! 50 However, if you do not want our scratches, 51 do not make above the pegola excessive.

Please translate each line literally into English.
52 Poi l’addentar con più di cento raffi, 53 disser: «Coverto convien che qui balli, 54 sì che, se puoi, nascosamente accaffi».
query.result: 52 Then to gnaw it with more than a hundred branches, 53 said: “Coverto it is necessary that here you dance, 54 so that, if you can, hidden you sit.”

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
55 Non altrimenti i cuoci a’ lor vassalli 56 fanno attuffare in mezzo la caldaia 57 la carne con li uncin, perché non galli.
query.result: 55 Not otherwise the cooks to their vassals 56 make thrust in the middle the cauldron 57 the meat with the hooks, because not roosters.

58 The good master “So that it does not appear 59 that you are there,” he said to me, “down you squat 60 after a scuffle, that some shield may have you;
61 and for no offense that has been made to me, 62 do not fear you, that I have the things counted, 63 because another time I was at such barter.”

67 With that fury and with that storm 68 that the dogs go out at the poor little one 69 who suddenly asks where he stops,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
76 Tutti gridaron: «Vada Malacoda!»; 77 per ch’un si mosse—e li altri stetter fermi— 78 e venne a lui dicendo: «Che li approda?».

Please translate each line literally into English.
79 «Credi tu, Malacoda, qui vedermi 80 esser venuto», disse ’l mio maestro, 81 «sicuro già da tutti vostri schermi,
82 sanza voler divino e fato destro? 83 Lascian’ andar, ché nel cielo è voluto 84 ch’i’ mostri altrui questo cammin silvestro».
query.result:
79 Do you believe, Malacoda, that here you see me 80 having come», said my master, 81 already safe from all your shields,
82 without divine will and straight fate? 83 Let them go, for in heaven it is willed 84 that I show others this forest path.
